intro: Heterotropa unzen, commonly known as the Unzen heterotropa, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Kyushu in Japan. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant has elliptical leaves with a smooth surface and produces small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
